Paying for College

Invite them to create a financial plan on how they will pay for college. For projected expenses, see www.byui.edu/catalog - look under the Admissions and Financial Policies section for Tuition, Fees and Expenses.

American Express, Discover, VISA and MasterCard are accepted with a 2.7% service charge (subject to change).

Invite them to visit the Financial Aid and Scholarship website at www.byui.edu/financial-aid.

If needed, explain the difference between financial aid and scholarships.

Explain there are scholarships they are automatically considered for as a student of the University, but there are others they will need to apply for.

See for http://www.byui.edu/financial-aid/policies/deadlines deadlines.

Spring 2014 deadlines

Invite them to explore their employment options on an off campus at www.byui.edu/human-resources/seeking-employment/student-employment.

Remind them that if they plan to work in Rexburg, they will need to bring the proper documentation. See www.byui.edu/documents/human-resources/acceptableID.pdf.

Paying Tuition

Inform the new students that they can pay their tuition before they arrive on campus. For payment methods see www.byui.edu/financial-services.

 

DEADLINES – payment is due 10 days before classes begin. You have one week after the first day of school to make changes in your classes. The payment deadline is 7 days after school starts. There is a 5% late fee assessed to your tuition after the 10 days. See www.byui.edu/financial-services/my-account.

Inform them that American Express, VISA, Discover and MasterCard are accepted with a 2.7% service charge (subject to change). Credit card payments can only be paid online through my.byui.edu – see the financial tab.

Registration Preparation & Registration

Check the Registration dates at www.byui.edu/registration/registration-schedule.

Invite them to visit Preparing for Registration and Registration FAQ at www.byui.edu/student-records.

If they have AP or concurrent enrollment credits have them contact Student Records and registration at registrar@byui.edu or by calling 208-496-1000. Information about transfer records and registration can be found at www.byui.edu/student-records and click on the transfer evaluation button.

If they are a transfer student refer them to Academic Discovery Center to determine the classes they will need to take at www.byui.edu/academic-discovery-center to talk with an advisor or contact them at 208-496-9800.

If they ARE NOT a transfer student or have AP or concurrent enrollment credits, help them access their grad plan at www.byui.edu/gradplan. They will need to know their netID and password.

Teach them how to determine the classes they need to register for by referring them to the Academic Discovery Center at www.byui.edu/adacemic-discovery-center/students/academic-advising-and-class-planning/class-planning.

Invite them to contact the academic discovery center if they have questions at 208-496-9800 or academicdiscoverycenter@byui.edu.

Inform them that registration begins at 6:00 a.m. Mountain Standard Time (MST) on their appointed day.
